Class PBMDataAccess

java.lang.Object
ch.supsi.dataaccess.image.PNMDataAccess
ch.supsi.dataaccess.image.PBMDataAccess
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageDataAccess
public final class PBMDataAccess extends PNMDataAccess
Provides functionality to read and write PBM image files in both ASCII (P1) and binary (P4) formats. Implements a Singleton pattern to ensure a single instance is used across the application. Extends PNMDataAccess for shared functionality with PNM formats.
See Also:
  • DataAccessFactory
  • ImageDataAccess

    • processBinary

      protected long[][] processBinary(InputStream is) throws IOException
      Processes binary (P4) PBM image data from the input stream and converts it into a 2D pixel array.
      Specified by:
      processBinary in class PNMDataAccess
      Parameters:
      is - the InputStream containing the binary PBM data
      Returns:
      a 2D array of pixels where each pixel is either 0 (white) or 1 (black)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input stream contains insufficient data or if there's an error while reading

      Throws:

    • writeBinary

      protected void writeBinary(OutputStream os, long[][] pixels, ExecutorService executor) throws IOException
      Writes binary (P4) PBM pixel data to the output stream using an executor for parallel processing.
      Specified by:
      writeBinary in class PNMDataAccess
      Parameters:
      os - the OutputStream to write to
      pixels - the 2D array of pixels to write
      executor - the ExecutorService used for parallel processing
